meanings.definition: Capable of being declined or decreased.
meanings.sent1: The number of cookies on the plate is declinable as people take them.
meanings.sent2: The declinable temperature made everyone reach for their jackets.
meanings.sent3: The declinable amount of sunlight made the plants think it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: Her declinable enthusiasm for the project was evident in her lack of participation.
meanings.sent5: The declinable interest in the topic led to a decrease in attendance.

meanings.definition: Able to be inflected for case, number, and gender in certain languages.
meanings.sent1: In Latin, nouns are declinable based on their roles in sentences.
meanings.sent2: The declinable endings of the verbs indicate the subject and tense.
meanings.sent3: The declinable adjectives in this language make it complex to learn.
meanings.sent4: Her declinable knowledge of Spanish allowed her to communicate effectively.
meanings.sent5: The declinable nature of the language added layers of meaning to the text.
